alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Rainfall, combined with melting snow, is expected. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall.

What: 
Total rainfall amounts of 10 to 20 mm with locally higher amounts possible.

When: 
Early Saturday morning into late Saturday afternoon.

Additional information: 
With thunderstorms possible, local rainfall amounts could exceed 20 mm over some areas. The rain will transition to flurries Saturday night. Icy or slippery surfaces are possible as temperatures are expected to plummet below freezing.

Localized flooding in low-lying areas and water pooling on roads are possible. 

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

affected_areas.area_description: Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Freezing rain Saturday afternoon and evening.

What:
Ice build-up of 1 to 3 mm possible on some surfaces.

When:
Beginning Saturday afternoon and continuing through Saturday night.

Additional information:
Snow is expected to change to ice pellets and freezing rain Saturday afternoon. More widespread freezing rain is expected to continue Saturday evening before transitioning to scattered flurries Saturday night.

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: winter storm warning in effect
alerts.description:
Hazardous winter conditions are expected.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions.

affected_areas.area_description: Ear Falls - Perrault Falls - Western Lac Seul

alerts.headline: winter storm warning in effect
alerts.description:
Hazardous winter conditions are expected.

What: 
Total snowfall amounts near 15 cm possible. 
Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow with wind gusts up to 60 km/h.
Ice build-up of 1 to 3 mm on some surfaces.

When: 
Tonight into Saturday night.

Additional information: 
A Colorado Low is expected to bring a wintry mix of precipitation across the region tonight. The precipitation is expected to begin as rain in some areas with amounts of 10 to 20 mm possible. The rain will become mixed with ice pellets or freezing rain, then transition to snow which could be heavy at times. Some surfaces may become icy or slippery with temperatures plummeting well below zero.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions.

affected_areas.area_description: Ear Falls - Perrault Falls - Western Lac Seul

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Patchy freezing rain continues.

What: 
Patchy freezing rain giving locally 1 to 2 mm of ice accretion.
Icy and slippery surfaces.

When:
Continuing into Saturday morning.

Additional information: 
Patchy freezing rain is expected to continue into Saturday morning. Freezing rain amounts are not expected to be overly significant, but untreated surfaces are likely to become icy and slippery.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

alerts.headline: winter storm warning in effect
alerts.description:
Hazardous winter conditions are expected.

What: 
Freezing rain with ice accumulations of 2 to 4 mm.
Snowfall amounts near 15 cm possible. 
Reduced visibility in snow and blowing snow.

When: 
Tonight into Saturday night.

Additional information: 
A Colorado Low is expected to bring a wintry mix of precipitation across the region tonight. Initially patchy freezing rain will become heavier and more widespread tonight and may be mixed with ice pellets at times. All precipitation will change over to snow by late Saturday morning, with gusty winds leading to reduced visibility in blowing snow.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

affected_areas.area_description: Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Freezing rain continuing into Saturday morning.

What:
Ice build-up of 1 to 3 mm possible on some surfaces.

When:
Continuing through Saturday morning.

Additional information:
Snow at times mixed with ice pellets and risk of freezing rain is expected tonight. Mostly freezing rain is expected over eastern portions of the region, including Weagamow Lake. To the west, mostly snow and ice pellets is expected. Freezing rain is expected to transition to snow and ice pellets Saturday morning.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

affected_areas.area_description: Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. Beware of branches or electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Prolonged freezing rain event continuing through Saturday.

What: 
Ice build-up of 2 to 5 mm possible on some surfaces. 

When:
Continuing through Saturday.

Additional information: 
Patchy freezing rain possibly mixed with ice pellets or snow is expected to continue tonight. Freezing rain will become heavier and more widespread early Saturday morning, continuing through the afternoon. Freezing rain will change to snow early Saturday evening. There is potential that areas near and south of Pickle Lake could change over to rain during this event, which would limit ice build-up amounts in these areas.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. Beware of branches or electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Freezing rain continuing into Saturday night.

What:
Ice build-up of 2 to 5 mm possible on some surfaces. 

When:
Continuing through Saturday night.

Additional information:
Freezing rain will become more widespread tonight and will be mixed with ice pellets and snow at times. Temperatures are expected to rise above the freezing mark on Saturday for most areas. However, it is possible that Lansdowne House may remain below the freezing mark throughout the day. Where temperatures rise above the freezing mark lower ice build-up amounts are expected.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Beware of branches or electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Freezing rain tonight into Saturday morning.

What:
Ice build-up of 2 to 4 mm possible on some surfaces.

When:
Beginning tonight and continuing into Saturday morning.

Additional information:
Snow will change to freezing rain at times mixed with ice pellets tonight south of James Bay and spreading north reaching Attawapiskat overnight. Freezing rain is expected to change over to rain Saturday morning as temperatures rise above the freezing mark.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Freezing rain Saturday and Saturday evening.

What:
Ice build-up of 2 to 4 mm possible on some surfaces.

When:
Beginning early Saturday morning and continuing through Saturday evening.

Additional information:
Snow at times mixed with ice pellets with a risk of freezing rain is expected tonight. A more widespread area of freezing rain is expected to develop Saturday morning. Freezing rain may be mixed with ice pellets at times. Freezing rain and ice pellets is expected to transition to snow Saturday night.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
